revised_title: Anatomical Findings and Reflections on the Causes of Dropsy
tldr: This article describes the anatomical findings of a woman who died of dropsy after a paracentesis was performed. The author, Dr. Charles Preston, discusses the complex of diseases present and reflects on the causes of dropsy, including the role of lymphatic vessels, the relaxation of blood vessel fibers, and the disposition of blood. He also considers the effects of the operation on the patient's survival.
